column4: I have an external ntfs hard drive (usb connection) that I can't seem to read from under my default user, only under root. Can someone help me with my fstab please?
what does that line of the fstab say?
did you set that up?
but you wrote that, not the installer, well you must have, it is mounted on the desktop for some strange reason
Yes, I wrote it myself. Should it be someplace else?
put it where you want, the rw needs to go because you can't write to ntfs
change the "auto" to "ntfs" and I would change the options to something like "ro,user,auto,fmask=0111,dmask=0000
/dev/sdb1 /home/rg535748/Desktop/EXTERNAL ntfs ro,user,auto,fmask=0111,dmask=0000 0 0
yeah, you can change it to "users" too like you had it. I don't know why I didn't leave that intact
What do I have to put there to allow my default user (I guess his ID would be like 1000) to access it?
the fmask and dmask should take care of that
I did that, did sudo mount -a, and still can't access it.
you should be able to, if you want to add uid=1000 to it, you can try
bash: cd: EXTERNAL/: Permission denied
should work
Doesn't, and I don't know why. :(
the fmask and dmask is setup to allow anyone to read it
don't know can you sudo cd into it
sudo gives me a 'cd command not found'
yeah don't know. Did you unmount it before you sudo mount -a
How do I unmount it?
sudo unmount /dev/sdb1
ok good
